result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian O Butterfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Early termination after 12 months upon approval of Agent.

miscConds.notes: Costs/Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No violent contact with any of the persons named in the criminal complaint.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Sign Medical Release for Agent.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Anger management and/or domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided and pay surcharge.    Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions STAYED, for use at Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian O Butterfield

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brian O Butterfield in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Bucher makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Defendants sister, mother and father (victim) make statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #2

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
60 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  
Term of Probation: 18 months
Early termination after 12 months upon approval of agent
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No violent contact with any of the persons named in the criminal complaint. 
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Sign Medical Release for Agent;
Anger management and/or domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.  
Condition Time: 10 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
FINE or COSTS:  $343.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
dated Dec 10, 2015 from Atty Paul Bucher, filed with documentation

Attorney Simon for attorney Paul E Bucher in court.   Defendant Brian O Butterfield did not appear.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Paul E Bucher in court.   Defendant Brian O Butterfield did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Paul E Bucher in court.   Defendant Brian O Butterfield did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.Defendant to have no violent contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Brian O Butterfield in court with attorney Thomas Simon for  Paul E Bucher.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
